definition: Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

pinyin: Na2 po4 lun2 · Bo1 na2 ba1

sentences.chinese: 这是决定波拿巴命运的数字。
你的同乡波拿巴还做了皇帝呢。

sentences.english: Well, Prince, so Genoa and Lucca are now just family estates of the Buonapartes.
sentences.chinese: 啊，公爵，热那亚和卢加现在是波拿巴家族的领地。

sentences.english: He was one of Bonaparte's colonels.
sentences.chinese: 那人是波拿巴的一个上校。

definition: variant of 拿破崙|拿破仑[Na2 po4 lun2]

pinyin: Na2 po4 lun2 · Bo1 na2 ba1

definition: Talleyrand (name)/Prince Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Périgord (1754-1838), French diplomat
Franco (name)/Generalissimo Francisco Franco Bahamonde (1892-1975), Spanish dictator and head of state 1939-1975

pinyin: Shen2 sheng4 Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2

definition: Jacobin club, French revolutionary party that played a leading role in the reign of terror 1791-1794
Bismarck (name)/Otto von Bismarck (1815-1898), Prussian politician, Minister-President of Prussia 1862-1873, Chancellor of Germany 1871-1890
